Nobody should be able to buy a gun without a background check. But that happens all the time b/c of the gun show and Charleston loopholes. We finally passed bills - #HR8 & #HR1112 - to fix that & keep dangerous weapons out of dangerous hands. 

#EndGunViolence #EnoughIsEnough pic.twitter.com/czKvU0ce7g

I'm honored to be serving as the Speaker Pro Tempore to oversee today's historic vote on a bill to close the loophole that allowed Dylan Roof to buy the gun he used to attack worshipers in Charleston. #HR1112 #EnoughIsEnough #EndGunViolence pic.twitter.com/Zl8YfuIBkh

Law & Tax Professor George Yin: IRS code is clear - the Treasury Secretary must disclose a president’s tax returns when requested by the @WaysMeansCmte chairman. It was written to match the president’s unlimited power to examine and disclose a citizen’s tax returns.

We’ve just started our hearing to learn about the 40 year tradition of Presidents releasing their tax returns and why ensuring good government also requires transparency from our leaders to ensure they’re following the law and working in our interest. pic.twitter.com/1bAk4wLHwH
